00020 /**
00021  * Start the display of a www page
00022  *
00023  * We have it as a function so we can customise all pages generated as
00024  * needed. This routine will open HTML, create the page header, and 
00025  * include any needed style sheets (if any) to provide a common 
00026  * look-and-feel for all pages generated.
00027  */
00028 function set_header()
00029 {
00030     global $app_name, $app_dir;
00031     // Start HTML vx.xx output
00032     echo "<html>";
00033     // Print headers
00034     echo "<head>";
00035     echo "<meta http-equiv=\"Content-Type\" content=\"text/html; charset=ISO-8859-1\">";
00036     echo "<meta name=\"DESCRIPTION\" content=\"a web interface to run TINKER molecular modelling on the EGEE grid\">";
00037     echo "<meta name=\"AUTHOR\" content=\"EMBnet/CNB\">";
00038     echo "<meta name=\"COPYRIGHT\" content=\"(c) 2004-5 by CSIC - Open Source Software\">";
00039     echo "<meta name=\"GENERATOR\" content=\"$app_name\">";
00040     echo "<link rel=\"StyleSheet\" href=\"$app_dir/style/style.css\" type=\"text/css\"/>";
00041     echo "<link rel=\"shortcut icon\" href=\"$app_dir/images/favicon.ico\"/>";
00042     echo "<title=\"$app_name\">";
00043     echo "</head>";
00044     // Prepare body
00045     echo "<body bgcolor=\"white\" background=\"$app_dir/images/6h2o-w-small.gif\" link=\"ffc600\" VLINK=\"#cc9900\" ALINK=\"#4682b4\">";
00046 }
00047 
00048 /**
00049  * close a web page
00050  *
00051  * Make sure we end the page with all the appropriate formulisms:
00052  * close the body, include copyright notice, state creator and
00053  * any needed details, and close the page.
00054  */
00055 function set_footer()
00056 {
00057         global $maintainer, $app_dir;
00058         // close body
00059         echo "</body><hr>";
00060         // footer
00061         echo "<center><table border=\"0\" width=\"90%\"><tr>";
00062             // Copyright and author
00063             echo "<td><A HREF=\"$app_dir/c/copyright.html\">&copy;</a>EMBnet/CNB</td>";
00064             // contact info
00065             echo "<td align=\"RIGHT\"><A HREF=\"emailto:$maintainer\">$maintainer</a></td>";
00066         echo "</tr></table></center>";
00067         // Page
00068         echo "</html>";
00069 }

00071 /**
00072  * print a warning
00073  *
00074  * Prints a warning in a separate pop-up window.
00075  * A warning is issued when a non-critical problem has been detected.
00076  * Execution can be resumed using some defaults, but the user should
00077  * be notified. In order to not disrupt the web page we are displaying
00078  * we use a JavaScript pop-up alert to notify the user.
00079  *
00080  * @param msg the warning message to send the user
00081  */
00082 function warning($msg)
00083 {
00084     echo "<script language=\"JavaScript\">";
00085     echo "alert(\"WARNING:\n $msg\");";
00086     echo "</script>";
00087 }
00088 
00089 /**
00090  * print an error message and exit
00091  *
00092  * Whenever we detect something wrong, we must tell the user. This function
00093  * will take an error message as its argument, format it suitably and
00094  * spit it out.
00095  *
00096  * @note This might look nicer using javascript to pop up a nice window with
00097  * the error message. Style sheets would be nice too.
00098  *
00099  * @param where the name of the caller routine or the process where the
00100  *              error occurred
00101  * @param what  a description of the abnormal condition that triggered
00102  *              the error
00103  */
00104 
00105 function error($where, $what)
00106 {
00107         // format the message
00108         echo "<p></p><center><table border=\"2\">\n";
00109         echo "<tr><td><center><font color=\"red\"><strong>\n";
00110 
00111         // output the message
00112         echo "ERROR - HORROR\n";
00113 
00114         // close format
00115         echo "</strong></font></center></td></tr>\n";
00116         echo "<tr><td><center><b>$where</b></center></td></tr>\n";
00117         echo "<tr><td><center>$what</center></td></tr>\n";
00118         echo "</table></center><p></p>\n";
00119 }
00120 
00121 /**
00122  * print a letal error message and die
00123  *
00124  * This function is called whenever a letal error (one that prevents
00125  * further processing) is detected. The function will spit out an
00126  * error message, close the page and exit the program.
00127  * It should seldomly be used, since it may potentially disrupt the
00128  * page layout (e.g. amid a table) by not closing open tags of which
00129  * it is unaware.
00130  * Actually it is a wrapper for error + terminate.
00131  *
00132  * @param where location (physical or logical) where the error was
00133  * detected: a physical location (routine name/line number) may be
00134  * helpful for debugging, a logical location (during which part of
00135  * the processing it happened) will be more helful to the user.
00136  *
00137  * @param what a descrition of the abnormality detected.
00138  */
00139 function letal($what, $where)
00140 {
00141         error($what, $where);
00142         set_footer();
00143         exit();
00144 }

00146 // ------------- SSH ROUTINES ----------------

00148 /**
00149  *  Execute a single command remotely using ssh and 
00150  * return its entire output (like passthru)
00151  *
00152  *  This might be done as well using a pipe on /tmp and
00153  * making the command 'cat' the pipe: when ssh runs, it
00154  * runs the command 'cat' on the pipe and hangs on read.
00155  *  Then we just need a thread to open the pipe, put the
00156  * password and close the pipe.
00157  *  This other way the password is never wirtten down.
00158  * But, OTOH, the file life is so ephemeral that most
00159  * of the time it will only exist in the internal system
00160  * cache, so this approach is not that bad either.
00161  *
00162  *  @param remote   The remote end to run the command, in
00163  *                  the form 'user@host' (or 'host' if the
00164  *                  username is the same).
00165  *  @param password The remote password. Note that if direct
00166  *                  RSA/DSA/.shosts/.rhosts login is enabled
00167  *                  then the password should be ignored as
00168  *                  SSH should not run the ASKPASS command).
00169  *  @param command  The command to execute on the remote end
00170  *                  NOTE: if you want to use redirection, the
00171  *                  entire remote command line should be 
00172  *                  enclosed in additional quotes!
00173  *  @param status   Optional, this will hold the termination
00174  *                  status of SSH after invocation, which
00175  *                  should be the exit status of the remote
00176  *                  command or 255 if an error occurred
00177  *  @return output  The output of the remote command.
00178  */
00179 function ssh_passthru($remote, $password, $command, $status)
00180 {
00181         umask(0077);
00182         $tmpfname = tempnam("/tmp", "egTinker");
00183         chmod($tmpfname, 0700);
00184         $fp = fopen($tmpfname, "w");
00185         fputs($fp, "#!/bin/sh\necho $password\n");
00186         fputs($fp, "rm -f $tmpfname\n");
00187         fclose($fp);
00188         putenv("DISPLAY=none:0.");
00189         putenv("SSH_ASKPASS=$tmpfname");
00190         return passthru("ssh -x -t -t $remote $command", $status);
00191 }
00192 
00193 // Do a remote scp connection with local password
00194 /**
00195  *  Copy a file or directory from one source to a destination
00196  *
00197  *  This function copies source to dest, where one of them is a
00198  * local filespec and the other a remote filespec of the form
00199  * [user@]host:path
00200  *
00201  *  If the original source is a directory, it will be copied
00202  * recursively to destination (hence easing file transfers).
00203  *
00204  *  The function returns TRUE on success or FALSE on failure.
00205  *
00206  */
00207 function ssh_copy($origin, $destination, $password)
00208 {
00209         umask(0077);
00210         $tmpfname = tempnam("/tmp", "egTinker");
00211         chmod($tmpfname, 0700);
00212         $fp = fopen($tmpfname, "w");
00213         fputs($fp, "#!/bin/sh\necho $password\n");
00214         fputs($fp, "rm $tmpfname\n");
00215         fclose($fp);
00216         putenv("DISPLAY=none:0.");
00217         putenv("SSH_ASKPASS=$tmpfname");
00218         system("scp -pqrC $origin $destination", $status);
00219         if ($status == 0)
00220             return TRUE;
00221         else
00222             return FALSE;
00223 }
00224 
00225 function ssh_open($remote, $password)
00226 {       
00227     global $php_version;
00228     global $debug;
00229 
00230     // Open a child process with the 'proc_open' function. 
00231     //
00232     // Some tricks: we must open the connection using '-x' to disable
00233     // X11 forwarding, and use '-t -t' to avoid SSH generating an error
00234     // because we are not connected to any terminal.
00235     // NOTE:
00236     //   We require users to have an account and password on
00237     //   the UI and provide their user/password through the web or
00238     //   otherwise (e.g. using myproxy)
00239     //
00240     // NOTE: if the web server is trusted remotely (i.e. it's SSH public 
00241     // key is accepted in ~user@host:.ssh/authorized_keys) then any 
00242     // password will do.
00243     if ($php_version < 5) {
00244         // Prepare I/O
00245         $descriptorspec = array(
00246             0 => array("pipe", "r"),  // connect child's stdin to the read end of a pipe
00247             1 => array("pipe", "w"),  // connect child's stdout to the write end of a pipe
00248             2 => array("pipe", "w")   // stderr is a pipe to read from
00249         );
00250         // prepare password
00251         putenv("DISPLAY=none:0.");
00252         putenv("SSH_ASKPASS=$tmpfname");
00253         umask(0077);
00254         $tmpfname = tempnam("/tmp", "egTinker");
00255         chmod($tmpfname, 0700);
00256         $fp = fopen($tmpfname, "w");
00257         fputs($fp, "#!/bin/sh\necho $password\n");
00258         fputs($fp, "rm $tmpfname\n");
00259         fclose($fp);
00260 
00261         $process = proc_open("ssh -x -t -t $remote", 
00262                          $descriptorspec,
00263                          $pipes);
00264         if ($debug) echo "ssh -x -t -t $remote<br />\n";
00265         // check status
00266         if (!is_resource($process)) 
00267         {
00268             letal("SSH::connect", "cannot connect to the remote host");
00269             return;
00270         }
00271         if ($debug) echo "proc_open<br />\n";
00272 
00273     }
00274     else {      /* php5 -- we can use PTYs */
00275             /* XXX -- untested -- probably unneeded */
00276         $descriptorspec = array(
00277             0 => array("pty"),
00278             1 => array("pty"),
00279             2 => array("pty")
00280         );
00281         // prepare password
00282         putenv("DISPLAY=none:0.");
00283         putenv("SSH_ASKPASS=$tmpfname");
00284         umask(0077);
00285         $tmpfname = tempnam("/tmp", "egTinker");
00286         chmod($tmpfname, 0700);
00287         $fp = fopen($tmpfname, "w");
00288         fputs($fp, "#!/bin/sh\necho $password\n");
00289         fputs($fp, "rm $tmpfname\n");
00290         fclose($fp);
00291 
00292         $process = proc_open("ssh -x -t -t $remote", 
00293                          $descriptorspec,
00294                          $pipes);
00295 
00296         // check status
00297         if (!is_resource($process)) 
00298         {
00299             letal("SSH::connect", "cannot connect to the remote host");
00300             return;
00301         }
00302 
00303         $status = proc_get_status($process);
00304         if ($status->running == FALSE) {
00305             fclose($pipes[0]); fclose($pipes[1]); fclose($pipes[2]);
00306             proc_close($process);
00307             letal("SSH::connect", "connection exited ".$status->exitcode);
00308             return;
00309         }
00310         if ($status->signaled) {
00311             fclose($pipes[0]); fclose($pipes[1]); fclose($pipes[2]);
00312             proc_close($process);
00313             letal("SSH::connect", "connection terminated by ".$status->termsig);
00314             return;
00315         }
00316         if ($status->stopped) {
00317             // Tell the user and hope for the best
00318             warning("SSH::connect stopped by ".$status->stopsig.
00319             " it may still have a chance though");
00320         }
00321 
00322     }
00323 
00324     // $pipes now looks like this:
00325     //   0 => writeable handle connected to child stdin
00326     //   1 => readable handle connected to child stdout
00327 
00328     // We now have a connection to the remote Grid User Interface
00329     // Server which we may use to send commands/receive output
00330     return array('stdin' => $pipes[0],
00331                  'stdout' => $pipes[1],
00332                  'stderr' => $pipes[2] );
00333 }
